channel.title: Need help adding commands. [562]
channel.description:
I'm running a 562.
This 562 has not got the ::rules nor :commands, commands.
I was wondering whether anyone had/knew the way to add these, I know I have to edit the Commands.java but I don't know how to do anything with the account of making a dialog appear; that's all I want. Basically I can't code.

item.title: Need help adding commands. [562]
item.dc:creator: @deadlyhorror deadlyhorror
item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

His pictures has a snowman wearing a DFH so yeah he’s using trisidiaX

Read full topic

item.title: Need help adding commands. [562]
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

i think it is deathlypvpz, i suggest you try to take a command for commands from another server.

item.title: Need help adding commands. [562]
item.dc:creator: @Brooklynn Brooklynn
item.description:
@Brooklynn wrote:

pretty sure thats a bug from trisidia source am i right?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help adding commands. [562]
item.dc:creator: @deadlyhorror deadlyhorror
item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

Yeah that’s it ^ but on mine it shows 100 lines so which ever ones you leave blank you have to insert a blank line.

EX: c.getPA().sendFrame126("",8160);

All the way until you have 100 lines >.<

It’s really a mess but I guess if you want the server itself to look alright you kinda don’t have a choice

Read full topic

item.title: Need help adding commands. [562]
item.dc:creator: @Kamran1 Kamran1
item.description:
@Kamran1 wrote:

After the 7 lines you wrote for command : rules,

Add 4 Blank lines, see if there’s any difference.

As in

                                c.getPA().sendFrame126("",8152);
                                c.getPA().sendFrame126("",8153);
                                c.getPA().sendFrame126("",8154);
                                c.getPA().sendFrame126("",8155);

Read full topic

item.title: Need help adding commands. [562]
item.dc:creator: @deadlyhorror deadlyhorror
item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

[quote=“Zeaonrs, post:3, topic:515605”]Thank you. But there’s a problem when the dialog comes up is displays these:

mjmptl.png761×501

and then scrolling further down…

2iqcqxi.png752×485
[/quote]

Yeah it does that. Has with every 562 I’ve messed with. As far as I know the only other option is making them appear in the chatbox instead. And as far as the second pic, I’ve never had it do that for me

Read full topic

item.title: Need help adding commands. [562]
item.dc:creator: @deadlyhorror deadlyhorror
item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("rules")) { c.getPA().showInterface(8134); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@ "SERVER HERE" Rules",8144); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@cya@RULE HERE",8145); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@RULE HERE",8146); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8147); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8148); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8149); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8150); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8151); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8152); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8153); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8154); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8155); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8156); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8157); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@RULE HERE",8158); }

try something like this…

Add or remove lines accordingly.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { c.getPA().showInterface(8134); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@ "SERVER HERE" Commands",8144); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@cya@All commands have a :: in front of it",8145); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@::COMMAND",8146); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8147); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8148); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8149); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8150); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8151); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8152); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8153); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8154); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8155); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8156); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8157); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@::COMMAND",8158); }

Add these under the public void playercommands method

Change the @_ colors as wanted.

Goodluck

Read full topic
